maml:description.maml:para: Download an access token.
Downloads a previously created EdgeKV access token. To download it, you need to know the token name.
Unique identifier for each namespace.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for each namespace.
Get a permission group.
Gets all access control groups or returns a specific group by its ID. With individual groups, you can view permissions available, such as create a namespace or read data from a namespace.
Unique identifier for an EdgeKV access group.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Gets the EdgeKV initialization status.

Read an item.

Gets all EdgeKV items for a given network, namespace, and group or returns a specific item by its ID. For the list, the operation returns up to 100 items by default or the number of items specified in the `-MaxItems` parameter. Items recently written to EdgeKV can take 10 seconds or longer to read and you may get a 404 error during that period.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Unique identifier for each namespace.
Unique identifier for an EdgeKV access group.
Unique identifier for each item. The key of a key-value pair.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Initialize EdgeKV.

Initializes EdgeKV (you need to do this only once) and adds the `default` EdgeKV namespace to Akamai's staging and production networks. It also creates a new dedicated CP code for you to track your EdgeKV usage. > Note: You'll be able to use the EdgeKV API operations or your EdgeKV database only after initialization completes. You should only use the `default` namespace for experimentation and testing purposes. When deploying your EdgeKV database to production, use a new namespace with a different name.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Create an access token.

Generates an access token that allows an EdgeWorkers code bundle to access the specified namespace. Each token name needs to be unique and have a defined expiration of no longer than six months. You can't renew a token once it expires. > Note: You can specify the token attributes as individual parameters or pipe a complete object to this function.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai production network.
Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai staging network.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Desired token expiration date in ISO 8601 format, `YYYY-MM-DD`, such as `2022-01-31`. Expiry can be up to six months from creation.
Friendly name of the token. Used when retrieving tokens by name.
The name of the namespace that you want to grant permissions to
Permissons to assign, as a combination of r for read, w for write, or d for delete, e.g. 'rwd'.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai production network.
Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai staging network.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Desired token expiration date in ISO 8601 format, `YYYY-MM-DD`, such as `2022-01-31`. Expiry can be up to six months from creation.
Friendly name of the token. Used when retrieving tokens by name.
The name of the namespace that you want to grant permissions to
Permissons to assign, as a combination of r for read, w for write, or d for delete, e.g. 'rwd'.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Write an EdgeKV item.

Creates or updates an EdgeKV item (name-value) on a given network. You need to specify the namespace and group to which the item belongs. The target namespace ID needs to already exist before writing. Whereas the group ID is automatically created for you if it doesn't exist yet. > Note: If you don't specify the group ID, a value of `0` is used, which makes the item available to all groups.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Unique identifier for each namespace.
Unique identifier for an EdgeKV access group.
Unique identifier for each item. The key of a key-value pair.
Value to assign to the new or updated item, can be a string or a PSCustomObject which will be converted to JSON. Supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeKV access group.
Unique identifier for each item. The key of a key-value pair.
Unique identifier for each namespace.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Value to assign to the new or updated item, can be a string or a PSCustomObject which will be converted to JSON. Supports pipelining.
Create a namespace.
Creates a namespace on Akamai's staging or production network. You should create namespaces first on the staging network so that you can test your EdgeWorkers code before you deploy it to production.
Friendly name of the token. Used when retrieving tokens by name.
Retention period of underlying data, represented in seconds. Accepts values between 86400 for one day and 315360000 for 10 years. You can also enter a value of `0` to retain data indefinitely.

Specifies the storage location for data when creating a namespace on the production network. This can help optimize performance by storing data where most of your users are located. Once you set this value, you can't modify it. The value defaults to US on the STAGING and PRODUCTION networks. The available locations on the PRODUCTION network also include EU (Europe), JP (Japan), and GLOBAL. The GLOBAL location automatically replicates data to US, EU, and JP storage locations. If you use the GLOBAL location, reads are faster but write operations are slighly slower. Default: US
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Unique identifier for an EdgeKV access group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Specifies the storage location for data when creating a namespace on the production network. This can help optimize performance by storing data where most of your users are located. Once you set this value, you can't modify it. The value defaults to US on the STAGING and PRODUCTION networks. The available locations on the PRODUCTION network also include EU (Europe), JP (Japan), and GLOBAL. The GLOBAL location automatically replicates data to US, EU, and JP storage locations. If you use the GLOBAL location, reads are faster but write operations are slighly slower. Default: US

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Revoke an access token.

Revokes a specified access token. Once you revoke it, you can't undo it. You also need to update any deployed EdgeWorkers code bundles that use the old token with a new token; otherwise, the requests to EdgeKV fail. Any requests from an EdgeWorkers code bundle using a revoked token cause a 401 error. To learn more about access tokens, see the EdgeKV guide (https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/docs/generate-and-retrieve-edgekv-access-tokens).
Unique identifier for each namespace.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for each namespace.
Delete an EdgeKV item.

Deletes an EdgeKV item. You need to specify the namespace and group to which the item belongs. It can take 10 seconds or longer for a deleted item to be removed from the database. If you attempt a `read` operation before the value has been updated globally, the stale data may be returned until the update is complete.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Unique identifier for each namespace.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Modify the default data access policy.

Modifies the default `dataAccessPolicy` setting that applies to new namespaces. By default, the `-RestrictDataAccess` parameter is `true` and the `-AllowNamespacePolicyOverride` parameter is `false`. You can provide the options individually or all at once with the `-Body` parameter.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Overrides the default dataAccessPolicy when creating a new namespace. A value of true allows you to override the dataAccessPolicy when creating a namespace. A value of false prevents new namespaces from overriding the default dataAccessPolicy.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Default dataAccessPolicy for new namespaces. A value of true allows new namespaces to access Akamai's Enhanced TLS network. A value of false allows access on both the Enhanced TLS and the Standard TLS networks. To set this value to false you need access to the EdgeKV Beta for Standard TLS.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Overrides the default dataAccessPolicy when creating a new namespace. A value of true allows you to override the dataAccessPolicy when creating a namespace. A value of false prevents new namespaces from overriding the default dataAccessPolicy.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Default dataAccessPolicy for new namespaces. A value of true allows new namespaces to access Akamai's Enhanced TLS network. A value of false allows access on both the Enhanced TLS and the Standard TLS networks. To set this value to false you need access to the EdgeKV Beta for Standard TLS.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Update namespace details.

Updates the retention period for any existing namespace other than the default namespace. It can take up to five minutes for a new retention policy to apply. The new retention period applies only to data added or updated in the namespace after this operation is complete. The retention period of existing data remains unchanged from the old retention period. Once you perform this operation, you can't query the previously existing data. If you want to ensure that all data in the namespace has the same retention period, you need to update the entire data set once the retention period has been updated.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
